## Our Dataset

We have **Big Five personality data** from a training study:

| Variable | Description |
|----------|-------------|
| `id` | Participant ID |
| `group` | control or training |
| `time` | pre or post |
| `p1`-`p5` | Personality items (1-5 scale) |

---

## Loading Packages

Before loading data, we need the `readr` package:

```{webr-r}
library(readr)
```

::: {.callout-note}
## Why readr?
`read_csv()` from readr is faster and creates tidier output than base R's `read.csv()`.
:::

---

## Loading from a URL

Data can be loaded directly from the internet:

```{webr-r}
# The URL where our data lives
data_url <- "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/LittleMonkeyLab/datarepo/main/personality_lab.csv"

# Load it!
data <- read_csv(data_url, show_col_types = FALSE)
```

---

## Inspecting: head()

`head()` shows the first few rows:

```{webr-r}
data_url <- "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/LittleMonkeyLab/datarepo/main/personality_lab.csv"
data <- read_csv(data_url, show_col_types = FALSE)

head(data)
```

---

## Inspecting: str()

`str()` shows the **structure** - column names and types:

```{webr-r}
data_url <- "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/LittleMonkeyLab/datarepo/main/personality_lab.csv"
data <- read_csv(data_url, show_col_types = FALSE)

str(data)
```

---

## Inspecting: dim()

`dim()` tells you **rows** and **columns**:

```{webr-r}
data_url <- "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/LittleMonkeyLab/datarepo/main/personality_lab.csv"
data <- read_csv(data_url, show_col_types = FALSE)

dim(data)
```

How many participants? How many variables?

---

## Accessing Columns

Use `$` to access a single column:

```{webr-r}
data_url <- "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/LittleMonkeyLab/datarepo/main/personality_lab.csv"
data <- read_csv(data_url, show_col_types = FALSE)

# Access the group column
data$group
```

---

## Common Error: Function Not Found

```r
read_csv("data.csv")
```

```
Error: could not find function "read_csv"
```

**Fix:** Load the package first!

```{webr-r}
library(readr)  # Load the package
# Now read_csv() works
```

---

You learned:

- How to load packages with `library()`
- How to load CSV data with `read_csv()`
- How to inspect data with `head()`, `str()`, `dim()`
- How to access columns with `$`
